Dear Tyler LAMONT Jones:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 pushed Youth A three times.
Investigation On 10/16/2024, I interviewed Complainant and Administrator;
no new information was provided.
On 12/4/24, I spoke to Foster Care Worker (FCW). No new
information was provided.
Staff 1 reported he did push Youth A three times on 10/15/24 as
Youth A pushed him. Staff 1 reported he should have stayed in a
protective stance instead of engaging with Youth A in this manner.
Staff 1 reported he “wrapped” Youth A up with his arms (bear hug
position). Staff 1 reported he didn’t realize that Staff 2 was close to
help in the situation.
Staff 2 reported Youth A and Staff 1 entered the room and Youth
A pushed Staff 1. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 pushed Youth A, a
couple of times and held him up against the couch. Staff 2
reported Youth A was released from this and Staff 1 did leave.
Staff 2 reported Staff 1 did not ask for help in this situation. This
incident happened quickly.
Youth A reported he pushed a youth and Staff 1 attempted to
deescalate him verbally. Youth A reported he went into the
adjoining room and thought Staff 1 was too close to him, so he
pushed him back. Youth A reported Staff 1 pushed him and
restrained him on the couch. Youth A reported he was released,
and Staff 1 left the room. Youth A reported he was not hurt and
did not need to see a nurse, nor did he ask to see a nurse.
Video Reviewed:
On 11/7/24 I reviewed the video dated 10/15/24 from 7:51pm-
7:53pm. Youth A was in the common area and pushed another
youth who was at the table. Staff 1 redirected Youth A. Youth A
then walked from the common space into an adjoining room. Staff
1 followed Youth A into the adjoining room. Staff 2 was already in
this room. Youth A then pushed Staff 1. After Youth A pushed
Staff 1, Staff 1 proceeded to push Youth A three times with open
hands towards Youth A. Staff 1 pushed Youth A in the head area.
Staff 1 also grabbed the back of Youth A’s neck and pushed him
up against the wall. Youth A was released from this and Staff 1 left
the unit.
2

Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1’s personnel file, all trainings and clearances were up
to date.
• Behavior management policy for the agency was reviewed
and stated pushing is not allowed.
• Incident report was reviewed, and it is in agreement with
the interviews above.
• There was no medical documentation to review.
Analysis The agency is in violation of this rule. Staff 1 admitted to pushing
Youth A.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
